Patch Set 1:

> Also I notice that the SMF manifest isn't validated apparently,

It is worth sorting out, but given we don't ship the service manifest dtd in this repo, we ought to wait for TOOLS-2178 and then use the common manifest linting target.

Patch Set 2:

Tim: On a smartos 1.6.3 build zone I get this failure:

```
[root@trent-builder-163-i386-20190221T002630 ~/joy/sdc-smart-login]# make all
mkdir -p bin
gcc -fPIC -g -Wall -Werror -I/root/joy/sdc-smart-login/hack-platform-include -nodefaultlibs -L/lib -L/usr/lib -lc -lnvpair -o bin/smartlogin  src/agent/bunyan.c src/agent/capi.c src/agent/config.c src/agent/hash.c src/agent/list.c src/agent/lru.c src/agent/nvpair_json.c src/agent/server.c src/agent/util.c src/agent/zutil.c -lzdoor -lzonecfg /usr/lib/libcurl.so.4
src/agent/nvpair_json.c: In function 'bunyan_nvlist_print_json':
src/agent/nvpair_json.c:135:3: error: enumeration value 'DATA_TYPE_DONTCARE' not handled in switch [-Werror=switch]
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors

make: *** [smartlogin] Error 1
```

validate-buildenv passes, FWIW:

```
[root@trent-builder-163-i386-20190221T002630 ~/joy/sdc-smart-login]# make validate-buildenv
/root/joy/sdc-smart-login/deps/eng/tools/validate-buildenv.sh
```

I was able to build sdc-rabbitmq on this same build machine, if that helps.

I *am* setting `export ENGBLD_SKIP_VALIDATE_BUILD_PLATFORM=1` if perhaps that is relevant for the smart-login build. I have this plat:

```
[root@trent-builder-163-i386-20190221T002630 ~/joy/sdc-smart-login]# uname -v
joyent_20180921T223234Z
```

Patch Set 2:

> Tim: On a smartos 1.6.3 build zone I get this failure:
.
.
 > src/agent/nvpair_json.c:135:3: error: enumeration value
 > 'DATA_TYPE_DONTCARE' not handled in switch [-Werror=switch]

Yes, this problem impacts binder as well and is a side effect of
building on platform newer than 20151126blah.

The breakage occurs as a result of a new enumeration item
in usr/src/uts/common/sys/nvpair.h

that landed as part of this illumos commit:

commit 2ec7644aab2a726a64681fa66c6db8731b160de1
Author: Serapheim Dimitropoulos <serapheim@delphix.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 5 09:57:42 2017 -0800

    9580 Add a hash-table on top of nvlist to speed-up operations
    Reviewed by: Matt Ahrens <matt@delphix.com>
    Reviewed by: Sebastien Roy <sebastien.roy@delphix.com>
    Approved by: Robert Mustacchi <rm@joyent.com>

We could hack it by adding an 'ifndef DATA_TYPE_DONTCARE' and defining
it to some value, but I'm not sure if that's crazy or not. This is
another case of needing to promote the use of retro build VMs among
developers, or coming up with a solution for sysroot builds.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1 Integration-Approval+1

Testing: I installed your dev build on nightly-1. I created a smartos VM (ea3c534c-cabd-657f-d520-9438fdc58f79) as this account:

```
$ triton -p nightly-1 account get
id: 83d93d95-6457-45d4-9aa5-a4bfeb600a14
login: trent.mick
```

and ssh'd to it. SSHing in was successful and the smartlogin log showed:

```
{"time":"2019-02-24T22:57:15.306Z","hostname":"headnode","name":"smart-login","pid":28375,"level":30,"v":0,"msg":"completed auth check","allowed":"yes","zone":"ea3c534c-cabd-657f-d520-9438fdc58f79","owner":"83d93d95-6457-45d4-9aa5-a4bfeb600a14","user":"root","ssh_fp":"82:97:39:7d:e9:f9:1e:a5:33:4d:b6:0e:9d:78:fa:11","timing_us":241811}
{"time":"2019-02-24T22:57:15.361Z","hostname":"headnode","name":"smart-login","pid":28375,"level":30,"v":0,"msg":"completed auth check","allowed":"yes","zone":"ea3c534c-cabd-657f-d520-9438fdc58f79","owner":"83d93d95-6457-45d4-9aa5-a4bfeb600a14","user":"root","ssh_fp":"82:97:39:7d:e9:f9:1e:a5:33:4d:b6:0e:9d:78:fa:11","timing_us":40}
```
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1
Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Tim Foster
Is this strictly true given we use pigz?

Yes. pigz is only a build-time dependency here. Our use
of the term 'base image' refers to the underlying zone content
that zfs images are built on top of. As this component
produces an agent rather than a zfs image, we don't
technically need to specify a base image.
time to remove?

We should remove it, but should also replace it with something 
that works. I'm guessing that ought to be smatch, but that's
not available for pkgsrc 1.6.3 afaict, and it seems like
we'd want a larger cross-Triton/Manta project to have a
proper eng.git framework for linting any c code we have.

Agree that would be nice, but let's not keep this while we're here. Lint is not *at all* supported for the platform right now, and keeping this around in its current form will just make things more complicated.
I'm fine removing it in this or a separate change. I'd generally bias to unrelated changes being in a separate ticket/change.
any point in comment now it's all standardized?

BITS_DIR was standardized before, so this is as much about
documenting our expectations to make the build more
approachable. I'd rather keep this in.
our dependency, prepublish, has already attempted to use this directory by this point, so this seems odd?

Yep, I agree - prepublish arrived fairly late in the lullaby
conversion process and I'd already modified this code
everywhere. I'll move this check there (which will
require an eng.git putback) and bump the submodule version
once that's available and remove this check.
Sounds good - though I'm not sure you need the check in eng's Makefile.targ since it will then be literally right next to the mkdir, and obvious for any reader.

On second thoughts, this is stupid. Makefile.defs already
defines ENGBLD_BITS_DIR, so it can never not be here. Let's
just remove this check here, and everywhere.
already done by prepublish?

True. As before, 'prepublish' was a relatively recent
addition which is why remnants of that are still here.

One argument I suppose for having this here is
that it makes the target a little more approachable
(nothing in the Makefile suggests we have a prepublish
dependency that does work)

Perhaps I ought to add a comment to that effect and remove
this.
Why this rather than adding to CLEAN_FILES ?
Good point, I'll fix that.
